attributes.action: I’d like to start a petition to keep it where it is.
attributes.additional_details: Ask them please, simply to help!
attributes.background:
I’d like the honourable house to consider my objection to any proposal of moving the War Memorial from its current location to any other location within our Parish.  As it currently stands in the heart of our Village and I strongly object to any proposal to have it moved!  

It is CH1 6EN

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local planning decisions are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
